Business Information: Dr. Thomas E. Powell, Dr. Dewey H. Jones III, and Dr. Dewey H. Jones IV are orthopedic surgeons who regard minimally invasive arthroscopic surgery, orthopedic surgery, and regenerative therapies not only as their passion, but also as their calling. Our doctors offer compassionate orthopedic care and spend ample time listening to their patients to develop customized surgical and non-surgical solutions for relieving pain, stiffness, swelling, and movement limitations. Our physicians are truly dedicated to their craft, treating people with general orthopedic conditions such as fractures, sports injuries, work-related injuries, and joint disease. In addition to performing arthroscopy, joint replacement surgery, and general orthopedic surgery, our surgeons perform surgery for the foot, ankle, hip, knee, shoulder, elbow, and wrist. Some of our physicians also administer ultrasound-guided medication injections to help relieve joint pain.

Located in Birmingham, Ala., Grayson and Associates is one of the largest groups of mental health clinicians in the United States. Established in 1985, the company has more than 50 clinicians and is one of the largest private practice providing mental health services to children, adolescents, and adults in Alabama. It offers a wide range of services, such as psychotherapy services, diagnostic testing, educational services, hospitalization, business consultations, sex therapy, couple therapy and neuropsychological evaluation.

Mitchell's Place is a nonprofit organization that provides diagnostic and treatment services for individuals with autism spectrum disorders. It serves children and adolescents throughout Alabama. The organization also offers family and community support services. Mitchell's Place provides early learning and after-school programs. It also conducts parent education classes, including parent coffee's, pot luck dinners and presentations. The organization s early learning program educates children between the ages of two and six and focuses on the cognitive, language, social, adaptive and motor development of children. Mitchell's Place maintains a staff of clinical psychologists, psychiatrists, and speech and language and occupational therapists. It is affiliated with the Autism Society of Alabama and operates a library. Mitchell's Place is located in Irondale, Ala.

Founded in 1996, the UAB Health System is a nonprofit partnership between the University of Alabama Board of Trustees and the University of Alabama Health Services Foundation. It provides a range of medical and health care services for the residents of Alabama. The UAB Health System operates University Hospital, which is an 890-plus-bed facility that spreads across an area of more than 885,000 feet. The hospital offers trauma, burn, surgical, neuroscience and cardiovascular intensive care solutions. In addition, the UAB Health System operates The Kirklin Clinic, which practices in the areas of dermatology, oncology, nephrology, urology and rheumatology and employs over 700 physicians. The system provides an administrative fellowship program.

Founded in 1999, Sharp & Stone OB/GYN, P.C. is a gynecology practice located in Birmingham, Ala. The center offers a range of services, such as pregnancy planning, pregnancy and infertility related advice, high-risk pregnancy consulting, gynecologic exams and pap smears, breast exams and treatment for abnormal uterine bleeding. The center also offers consultation in matters, such as heavy menses, painful menses, uterine fibroids, pelvic prolapse, pelvic pain, urinary incontinence, hysterectomy and menopause. Sharp & Stone OB/GYN, P.C. is a member of the American College of Obstetricians & Gynecologists.

Business Information: Founded in 1979, National Alliance on Mental Illness, also known as NAMI, is a nonprofit organization for people who suffer from mental illnesses and their families. It advocates for the public and private policies that facilitate research, end discrimination and promote effective mental health care programs. The organization provides various educational programs, including Family-to-Family, NAMI Connection and Hearts and Minds for consumers, family members, providers and the public. NAMI offers discounts on brochures, videos and promotional items during state and local conferences. It organizes group discussions on mental health-related issues. The organization operates a help line that provides information and referral services. NAMI provide informational resources on topics related to schizophrenia, bipolar disorder and depression. National Alliance on Mental Illness is located in Arlington, Va.
